title.narrative: EU Support to Higher Education in ASEAN Region (EU SHARE)

description.narrative: The Support to Higher Education in the ASEAN Region (SHARE) Programme is the European Union’s flagship higher education programme with ASEAN. The Programme is implemented by a consortium comprised of the British Council, the DAAD, ENQA and Nuffic. SHARE enables the programme to provide technical assistance to the ASEAN Secretariat and regional stakeholders in their implementation of the ASEAN Work Plan on Education 2021-2025, which was adopted by the ASEAN Education Ministers Meeting (ASED) on May 31st, 2021.

The overall objective is to strengthen regional co-operation, enhance the quality, regional competitiveness and internationalisation of ASEAN Higher Education institutions and students, contributing to an ASEAN Community • To enhance the harmonisation of ASEAN Higher Education (HE) area through the formulation of ASEAN Higher Education frameworks, taking into account the EU experience and promotion of equal access for girls and women to quality Higher Education free from discrimination. • To support mutual recognition, student mobility and equal opportunities for all, including female students, and people with disabilities, among HEIs in ASEAN, and to strengthen people to people connectivity.

• ASEAN Secretariat • Senior Officials Meeting on Education (SOM ED) • ASEAN and national level Higher Education (HE) policy makers • ASEAN wide and national organisations responsible for Quality Assurance, and Qualifications Frameworks for HE • ASEAN level and national organisations responsible for developing and maintaining academic credit transfer schemes for HE • Students seeking mobility opportunities for HE

participating-org.narrative: Deutscher Akademischer Austauschdienst e.V. (German Academic Exchange Service) (DAAD)
ENQA (European Association for Quality Assurance in Higher Education)

name.narrative: EU Support to Higher Education in ASEAN Region (EU SHARE) is a regional project, delivered in all 10 ASEAN countries. The main office is based in Jakarta, Indonesia.
